intro: Argyranthemum foeniculaceum, commonly known as the sweet marigold, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden borders and containers. The flowers are not only ornamental but also have a mild, sweet scent, contributing to its appeal in both landscape design and herbal use.
